name: Monk Juice
description: The first beer after living in Germany for 3 years! Belgian beers are typically forgiving, taste excellent and are an ale, which means it will be ready earlier. It should be a light bodied, golden ale with a typical Belgian profile. Start small. Prost!
brewing_instructions: Add 6 gallons of water to the kettler and add 1 tablet of xxx
Heat 6 gallons of strike water to 161°F
Add 6 gallons of water to the mash tun
Add all grains to the mash tun and confirm mash temperature of 153°F
Steep grains for 60 minutes
While steeping grains, heat 4 gallons of water for lautering to 170 °F
Fly spage until wort volume of 7.3 gallons is reached
Begin boil and wait for hot break
At 0 minutes, add 15 drops of FermCap to reduce foaming
At 0 minutes, add 1 oz Hallertauer Mittelfrüh hops
At 40 minutes, add 0.5 oz Hallertauer Mittelfrüh hops
At 45 minutes, add 1 lb Candi Sugar
At 50 minutes, add 1 oz Hallertauer Mittelfrüh hops
At 50 minutes, add 1 tablet Whirlfloc
At 50 minutes, add 0.5 tsp of yeast nutrient
At 60 minutes, chil the wort to 60°F
Aerate with pure oxygen for 1 minute
Move wort to primary fermenter
Pitch yeast
Ferment at 67°F for 7 days
Ferment at 72°F for 2 days
Ferment at 65°F for 2 days
Cold crash to 36°F for 7 days
Move to keg and carbonate
starter_brewing_instructions: Add 3L of water to Ehrlenmeyer Flask
Add 6 oz Extra Light Dry Malt Extract
Add 5 drops FermCap to reduce foaming as needed
Allow yeast to multiply for 36-48 hours
